newsitem.title: INDIA: India's Unitech sees 40 pct sales growth.
newsitem.headline: India's Unitech sees 40 pct sales growth.

text.p: Indian real estate company Unitech Ltd expects total income in 1996/97 (April-March) to grow by about 40 percent over 2.6 billion rupees in 1995/96, director G.R. Bahri said on Tuesday.

"Last year we did 2.6 billion rupees. Our growth should be about 40 percent in the current one," Bahri told Reuters in an interview. He said the rise would come largely from real estate development, construction services and hotel building.
Bahri said Unitech this month would begin building a commercial complex in South City, a township it is developing just outside the Delhi border in the northern state of Haryana.
He said a 780-million-rupee five-star hotel that Unitech is building in collaboration with India's A.L. Batra group near Delhi's international airport is expected to be completed by the end of 1996.
Unitech holds a 75 percent stake in the joint venture hotel, which Bahri said would be affiliated with the Radisson hotel group.
